answers.answer: Your docs and midwives would go by your ultrasound date so if they said 10w 7 days essentially your 11 weeks. It generally shouldn't change from that unless you measure differently 3 times. Congratulations

Same happened to me at my 12 week ultrasound sound. I was 12+1 and measuring 12+6. I didn't understand how because I knew when I ovulated but,  they said baby measured bigger and it's correct. Im 20+3 weeks and have another u/s on the 18th so I'll know if I'm still measuring big!

I'm in the same boat...Monday at my dr appt I got measured and I was measuring 35 36 and at the time I was 32 weeks now yesterday I went to the er cause I wasn't feeling well and they did it again and now they say I'm measuring 38 I have an ultrasound appt on Tuesday. I just turned 33weeks today...so I'm wondering if this means I will deliver early. By the way I have to have a c section
So, the doctors measurements are correct? I'm really 11 weeks and not 10?

I am 38+5 and my baby has been measuring big since 24w weeks. Due date has not changed at all. It could be from genetics that your baby is big (which is in my case) or from gestational diabetes. Which they will test for that between 24-28 weeks. Don't worry or stress too much.
All babies in my family have been big. All have been over 8 pounds. My cousin recently gave birth to her son. He was 10 pounds!

question: According to my calculations I'm 10 weeks 3 days. But baby measured at 10 weeks 7 days? Which is right?!
title: Baby measuring big.
